page.title: 15Bitton Railway Society.
page.content: Bitton station is between Bristol and Bath.The railway line there was formerly owned and managed by the Midland Railway Company.In 1803 they put forward plans but the line was not opened until 1869.Just over 100years later British Rail closed the line and lifted the track.1973 a few people formed the Bristol Suburban Railway Society.Since then they have layed 1.5 miles of track and acquired and restored a number of steam and diesel locomotives. The three main loco builders in Bristol were Fox Walker,Avonside and Peckett and Co.The BSRS currently has one of each company's loco.Their most recent project has been to preserve "Littleton No5"their 5th loco,built in Leeds.It should be steamed in Sept.'85. by Chris Nichols (age 14,member BSRS.)
